snippet: Kim Davis, the clerk of Rowan County, Ky., has drawn scorn and praise for her opposition to same-sex marriage.
abstract: Profile of Kim Davis, Rowan County, Ky, clerk who has emerged as national symbol after refusing to issue marriage certificates to same-sex couples, defying Supreme Court ruling.

byline.original: By ALAN BLINDER and RICHARD FAUSSET
byline.contributor: Alan Blinder reported from Morehead, and Richard Fausset from Atlanta.

lead_paragraph: Kim Davis, the clerk of Rowan County, Ky., has drawn scorn and praise for her opposition to same-sex marriage.

headline.main: Kim Davis, a Local Fixture, and Now a National Symbol
headline.print_headline: County Clerk, a Local Fixture, Suddenly Becomes a National Symbol

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
